summary: France defender Estelle Cascarino becomes Rita Guarino's first signing since her appointment last month.

title: How Android 16 quietly became Googleâ€™s best update in years
summary: It started as the most boring update, but Android 16 has grown into a very impressive, feature-filled version.
body: When Android 16 landed on Pixels early last summer, it didnâ€™t make much of a splash. To say that many of us were disappointed by what we saw â€” or what we didnâ€™t see, to be fair â€” would be an understatement. Android 16 felt like Android 15.1, a minor upgrade with some interesting new features, but nothing more. A lot of what was promised with Android 16 didnâ€™t come with that first release. Instead, it took a few months and a couple of quarterly updates, but itâ€™s obvious to me now that Android 16 is the best Android version weâ€™ve had in many years.

title: ChaseÂ Atlantic Preps â€˜Lost In Heavenâ€™ ConcertÂ Film
summary: Becky Garner directs the film, which captures the final night of the bandâ€™s 'Lost In Heaven' European Tour, last May at Londonâ€™s O2 Arena.
body: Chase Atlantic is coming to a movie theater near you. The Australian trio is front and center for Chase Atlantic: Lost In Heaven , a feature-length concert film due out next month in cinemas worldwide through Trafalgar Releasing and VEEPS Studios. The film captures the final night of the bandâ€™s Lost In Heaven European tour, presented May 4, 2025 at Londonâ€™s iconic O2 Arena. â€œReliving one of our biggest shows ever, performing at the O2, with fans across the world is incredible,â€ comments frontman Mitchel Cave. â€œWe wanted everyone, everywhere – not just the people who were there – to be able to feel the energy of that concert.â€ Hailing from Cairns in the far north of Queensland, the outfit is led by brothers Mitchel (lead singer) and Clinton Cave (lead guitarist and saxophone), along with Christian Anthony (singer and guitarist). For their Lost In Heaven global tour, which kicked off with a North America leg in October 2024 and wrapped November 2025 in South America, the trio was joined by friends Jesse Boyle (drummer) and Pat Wilde (bassist and guitarist). With their special blending of pop, rock, and R&B, Chase Atlantic has emerged as one of Australiaâ€™s tâ€¦

title: CES 2026: Segway Navimowâ€™s latest robotic lawn mowers are â€œdrop and mowâ€ ready
summary: Segway Navimow unveiled its latest robot lawn mowers, featuring significant performance and feature upgrades.
body: Credit: Navimow Beautiful, picture-perfect lawns and backyards look fantastic, but anyone who has had to drag around a heavy lawn mower knows how difficult and time-consuming they are to maintain. And even if you went the robot lawn mower route before, installing base stations and perimeter wires is another complicated and tedious chore. Segway Navimow addresses both of these concerns and more with their latest robot lawn mowers. Navimow showed off five new lineups at CES 2026 â€“ four ideal for residential use, while a new series marks the brandâ€™s first foray into commercial lawn mowing. The i2, H2, X4, and Terranox series address very different yard types, from simple suburban lawns to complex, obstacle-dense landscapes and extreme terrain. And most importantly, they make lawn maintenance a breeze.

title: I turned my Pixel 10 Pro into a 2026 BlackBerry and LG Wing â€” seriously
summary: Keyboard cases aren't my thing, but the Clicks Power Keyboard has my attention.
body: For the last couple of years, Clicks has been one of the more interesting brands in the mobile accessory space. After creating keyboard cases for various iPhone and Android phone models, the company came to CES 2026 to showcase something a little different: a keyboard you can attach to any smartphone, without the commitment of a full-on case. Itâ€™s called the Clicks Power Keyboard, and it snaps onto the back of your phone via MagSafe/Qi2 magnets â€” instantly turning your phone into a modern-day BlackBerry. Compared to Clicksâ€™ keyboard cases , the Power Keyboard has a couple of key benefits: 1) You can attach and remove the Clicks Power Keyboard much more easily than a case, and 2) it allows the keyboard to be attach to any phone that has magnets, whether built into it or via a compatible case.

title: RayNeo Air 4 Pro brings worldâ€™s first HDR10 AR display to your face
summary: These 76g glasses feature Bang & Olufsen audio and a custom Vision 4000 chip for an immersive 201-inch cinema experience.
body: RayNeo Air 4 Pro: Worldâ€™s First HDR10-enabled AR Glasses TL;DR RayNeo has launched the Air 4 Pro globally at CES 2026, featuring the worldâ€™s first HDR10 AR displays and Bang & Olufsen-tuned audio. The Air 4 Pro uses FHD micro-OLED displays to create a virtual 201-inch screen experience. These lightweight glasses are expected to go on sale on January 25 for $299. RayNeo has been making AR glasses for a while now, and the company just launched the RayNeo Air 4 Pro at CES 2026 . This marks the global debut of their latest AR glasses, which were launched in China last year. With the Air 4 Pro, RayNeo aims to deliver a cinema-like experience in a lightweight wearable form factor. It claims that these are the worldâ€™s first HDR10 AR displays, offering brighter highlights, deeper shadows, and enhanced color and contrast within the AR experience. A Pixelworks-customized Vision 4000 chip offers real-time video enhancements, such as upscaling SDR content to HDR and converting 2D videos into 3D.

title: Bad with directions? Hereâ€™s how Google Maps on Android XR could help you never get lost again
summary: Or help you course-correct when you end up getting lost anyway.
body: TL;DR Google might have begun working on navigation support for Android XR using Google Maps. Previously, Google has previewed how Maps and Gemini could work together to help you navigate, especially while walking. In addition to step-by-step navigation, your Android XR glasses could use feed from their cameras to help you when youâ€™re feeling lost. Google will also give users the option to turn off navigation or alerts if they donâ€™t want to use it. Android XR is Googleâ€™s next big ambitious project that it envisages to power dozens of different styles of AR glasses and XR headsets over the next few years. Since the platform is closely related to the mobile version of Android, weâ€™d also see a significant chunk of apps cross-functioning across both platforms. Maps is one of them, and Google has already demonstrated how you can use the app to find places of interest or for an immersive aerial or street view. Now, weâ€™re seeing hints about how Android XR could enhance navigation in Google Maps, especially when youâ€™re walking down the street. title: Leeds and Wales legend Yorath dies aged 75
summary: Terry Yorath, who won the league title with Leeds in 1974 and came close to guiding Wales to the 1994 World Cup finals, dies at the age of 75.

title: Samsung concludes Galaxy Ring investigation after swelling sent user to hospital
summary: Samsung says cracked molding, not battery, was to blame for the incident.
body: Credit: X/@ZONEofTECH TL;DR Samsung has completed its investigation into an incident that sent tech creator Daniel (@ZONEofTECH) to the hospital last year. The company states that the swelling in Danielâ€™s Galaxy Ring was caused by a crack in its internal molding, not the battery. Samsung and an independent agency both reached the same conclusion. Samsung has officially concluded its investigation into a Galaxy Ring incident that sent a tech creator to the hospital in October last year. The company has reportedly determined that the issue was caused by a crack in the Galaxy Ringâ€™s internal molding, confirming that the device doesnâ€™t pose any wider battery safety risks.

title: Your Android-powered car will get faster updates thanks to Qualcomm
summary: Does your car have Android Automotive? There might be good news for you.
body: Credit: Google TL;DR Qualcomm has announced a partnership with Google for a â€œunified reference platformâ€ for Android Automotive OS, starting with Android 17. This means cars with Android Automotive and Snapdragon chips should get quicker access to new Google features. The chipmaker also announced that Project Treble is coming to cars with Snapdragon chips, speeding up system updates. Cars with Android Automotive OS offer a standalone Android experience without having to pair with an Android device. Now, Google and Qualcomm have announced some welcome developments in this space. title: Players 'not protected' over schedule - Sabalenka
summary: World number one Aryna Sabalenka says tennis authorities "follow their interests" with regards to the tennis calendar and are not "focusing on protecting all of us".

title: Unloved in PE, ignored at top - what is cross country's future?
summary: Cross country evokes miserable school memories for many, while top athletes focus on Olympic disciplines instead - what is its future?

title: The first Android Canary release of 2026 is here!
summary: The first Android Canary release of 2026 is here, and there are a couple of changes worth knowing.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google has released the January 2026 Android Canary build. Weâ€™ve found evidence that this software could bring Quick Share/AirDrop integration to Pixel 9 phones. We also spotted a few other visual changes compared to previous releases. Google regularly offers Android Canary builds, allowing users to try new features and changes before theyâ€™re broadly released. Google launched the December 2025 Android Canary build a month ago, and itâ€™s wasting no time in launching its first build of 2026. The company just released the January 2026 Android Canary build, dubbed Android Canary 2601. This build has the version number ZP11.251212.007.

title: Yungblud Gives Playful Shoutout to His Mature AustralianÂ Fans
summary: As he prepares for the start of his Australian tour, Yungblud had a tongue-in-cheek message.
body: Yungblud , it would seem, has a special place in his heart for his for mature fans. Ahead of his Australian tour opener in Sydney, the British alternative pop artist shared a multi-page post on Instagram, with the caption: â€œTell the cougars Iâ€™ll see em Saturday night.â€ The 28-year-old artist (real name: Dominic Harrison) is clearly having a laugh, and in a relationship with Jesse Jo Stark, making the comment after sharing some spicy insights on his female fans with local journalist Kathy McCabe. â€œIâ€™m telling you, the older birds, theyâ€™re a bit more aggressive. Itâ€™s crazy, you know what I mean? The nails are sharper,â€ he’s quoted as saying for an article published in news.com.au . â€œIâ€™m down (for it). Itâ€™s definitely another generationâ€™s vibe but whatever man, rockâ€™nâ€™roll.â€ Yungbludâ€™s social post also features a clipping of the â€œCougarsâ€ story, plus a snap with retired Australian cricket star David Warner, a box of tasty Aussie snacks, and more. View this post on Instagram Produced by Frontier Touring, the Australian swing of Yungbludâ€™s IDOLS World Tour gets underway Jan. 10 at Sydneyâ€™s Qudos Bank Arena, followed by shows in Melbourne, Adelaide, Brisbane, and wraps up Jan. 20 â€¦

title: The NFL record-breaker who never planned to play the sport
summary: Jacksonville Jaguars kicker Cam Little holds the record for the NFL's longest field goal - not bad for someone who never planned to play the sport.

title: McCullum keen to remain as England head coach despite Ashes defeat
summary: Brendan McCullum says he's "not opposed" to making adjustments but says a complete overhaul of his approach won't be in store should he remain England coach, following their 4-1 Ashes series defeat to Australia down under.

title: 'Areas to improve' but McCullum 'won't be told what to do'
summary: Coach Brendon McCullum says he will not be told what to do but accepts there are "areas to improve" after England's Ashes defeat.

title: 'We need to be smarter' - Stokes admits England must improve
summary: Ben Stokes says it's time for "some honest truths" to be shared amongst his team, following England's 4-1 Ashes series defeat in Australia.

title: Jealous of Pixel 10â€™s AirDrop trick? Pixel 9 is getting it too with latest Android Canary build
summary: The Pixel 9 series is next in line to support AirDrop-style sharing between Android and iPhone.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google has added AirDrop-related Quick Share system files to the Pixel 9 series firmware with the latest Android Canary build. Pixel 9a and Pixel 8 series devices donâ€™t yet have these files, suggesting support isnâ€™t reaching older Pixels yet. When Google announced Quick Share interoperability with Appleâ€™s AirDrop late last year, the feature was introduced as a Pixel 10 exclusive. But new evidence suggests that exclusivity may not last very long. Weâ€™ve found signs that AirDrop-style sharing between Android and iPhone is now being prepared for older Pixel phones, starting with the Pixel 9 series.

title: England show fight but fall short as Australia seal 4-1 Ashes win
summary: After bowling England out for 342, Australia chase down their winning target of 160 with five wickets in hand to win the fifth Ashes Test on the final day in Sydney, sealing a 4-1 series win to retain the urn.

title: England show fight but fall short as Australia seal 4-1 Ashes win
summary: After bowling England out for 342, Australia chase down their winning target of 160 with five wickets in hand to win the fifth Ashes Test on the final day in Sydney, sealing a 4-1 series win to retain the urn.

title: Meltwater Turns Iceberg A-23A Blue
summary: After a four-decade run, the massive, waterlogged berg is leaking meltwater and on the verge of disintegrating.
body: Earth Observatory Science Earth Observatory Meltwater Turns Iceberg A-23Aâ€¦ Earth Earth Observatory Image of the Day EO Explorer Topics All Topics Atmosphere Land Heat & Radiation Life on Earth Human Dimensions Natural Events Oceans Remote Sensing Technology Snow & Ice Water More Content Search Collections Global Maps World of Change Articles Notes from the Field Blog Earth Matters Blog Blue Marble: Next Generation EO Kids Mission: Biomes About About Us Subscribe ğŸ›œ RSS Contact Us December 26, 2025 The year that iceberg A-23A first broke away from Antarcticaâ€™s Filchner Ice Shelf , Ronald Reagan was president of the United States, and the movie Top Gun was setting box office records. Forty years later, the massive tabular bergâ€”one of the largest and longest-lived bergs ever tracked by scientistsâ€”is sopping with blue meltwater and on the verge of complete disintegration as it drifts in the South Atlantic between the eastern tip of South America and South Georgia island. When it first detached from Antarctica in 1986, the berg was nearly twice the size of Rhode Islandâ€”about 4,000 square kilometers. title: 25 Years in Orbit: Science, Innovation, and the Future of Exploration
summary: NASA and its partners have supported humans continuously living and working in space since November 2000. A truly global endeavor, the International Space Station has been visited by more than 290 people from 26 countries and a variety of international and commercial spacecraft. The unique micrograâ€¦
body: NASA astronaut Jasmin Moghbeli retrieves media bags inside the International Space Station’s Kibo laboratory module for Emory University’s Project EAGLE investigation. NASA NASA and its partners have supported humans continuously living and working in space since November 2000. A truly global endeavor, the International Space Station has been visited by more than 290 people from 26 countries and a variety of international and commercial spacecraft. The unique microgravity laboratory has hosted more than 4,000 experiments from over 5,000 researchers from 110 countries. The space station also is facilitating the growth of a commercial market in low Earth orbit for research, technology development, and crew and cargo transportation.  After a quarter of century of human presence in orbit, the station remains a symbol of international cooperation and a proving ground for humanityâ€™s next giant leaps to the Moon and, eventually, Mars.   September’s full Moon, the Harvest Moon, is photographed from the space station, placed in between exterior station hardware. title: US judge hits Samsung with restraining order over â€˜spying onâ€™ smart TV users

body: TL;DR Samsung is one of five TV manufacturers accused of illegally collecting automated content recognition (ACR) data from TVs in the state of Texas. A new temporary restraining order bars Samsung from collecting ACR data within the state. A hearing to potentially impose a temporary injunction against Samsung is scheduled for January 9. Last month, Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton filed suit against five TV manufacturers for â€œspying on Texansâ€ through the use of automated content recognition (ACR). In the suits, Sony, Samsung, LG, Hisense, and TCL are all accused of surreptitiously harvesting screenshots of usersâ€™ TV content for the purpose of targeted advertising. This week, Paxtonâ€™s office announced a new development: a judge in Texas has issued a temporary restraining order against Samsung, stopping the practice within the state. As spotted by SamMobile , the new restraining order signed by State District Judge Benjamin Smith calls for Samsung and anyone working with the company to halt any collection, sharing, or use of ACR data related to users in Texas, citing violations of the stateâ€™s Deceptive Trade Practices Act . A hearing on the case has been scheduled this Friday, Jaâ€¦

title: Samsung explains why your Galaxy phone sits on outdated Google Play System Updates
summary: And has promised to finally release new updates in January 2026.
body: Credit: Tushar Mehta / Android Authority TL;DR Samsung has acknowledged its less-than-frequent Google Play system updates on Galaxy devices. It has said that it only delivers software after testing, refuting Googleâ€™s plan to split updates into crucial and optional updates. However, it has said that it will resume updates in January 2026. In 2019, Google set out to split Android updates into two parts, so it could deliver crucial features directly to users without needing manufacturers to first adapt them to their custom skins. These updates, now known as Google Play system updates, are responsible for key Android features such as Digital Wellbeing, Privacy Dashboard, theft protection, to name a few. Thatâ€™s where the Pixel-like UI in some Settings menus comes from. And while Google intended to simplify updates by splitting them, it ended up complicating it for users . Thatâ€™s because Google Play system updates, which are different from the Google Play Services app you see in the Play Store, donâ€™t always download automatically and often need to be triggered manually from a separate menu, distinct from the usual System Updates section. Itâ€™s alright if you never bothered to check theseâ€¦

At CES 2026, the company confirmed the shortage is already raising costs and admitted itâ€™s actively considering repricing products to match the new reality. DRAM and storage power everything from phones to fridges, but AI servers are buying it in bulk, leaving less for consumer devices. Samsung just issued a warning thatâ€™s hard to miss. The huge demand for memory chips â€” driven by AI data center buildouts â€” is squeezing supplies so tightly that prices across the electronics world are set to climb. At CES 2026 in Las Vegas, Samsungâ€™s global marketing head, Wonjin Lee, made it clear that shortages in memory supply are real, and theyâ€™re already nudging costs upward, Bloomberg reports. While the company doesnâ€™t want to pass those costs straight to shoppers, Lee admitted that Samsung is starting to consider â€œrepricingâ€ its products to reflect the new economics.

title: Algae Swirls Across a South African Reservoir
summary: Vivid green blooms form, drift, and fade in Hartbeespoortdam reservoir over the course of a year.
body: Earth Observatory Science Earth Observatory Algae Swirls Across a Southâ€¦ Earth Earth Observatory Image of the Day EO Explorer Topics All Topics Atmosphere Land Heat & Radiation Life on Earth Human Dimensions Natural Events Oceans Remote Sensing Technology Snow & Ice Water More Content Search Collections Global Maps World of Change Articles Notes from the Field Blog Earth Matters Blog Blue Marble: Next Generation EO Kids Mission: Biomes About About Us Subscribe ğŸ›œ RSS Contact Us To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video June 2022-July 2023 On clear days in Hartbeespoort, South Africa, satellite images often reveal a reservoir with shades of deep blue interrupted by drifting patches of vivid green. In this animation, from June 2022 to July 2023, an algal bloom grows, moves around the reservoir, and then fades. In this video, which is the longest-spanning one ever released by Chandra, X-rays (blue) from the telescope have been combined with an optical image (red, green, and blue) from Pan-STARRS. X-ray: NASA/CXC/SAO; Optical: Pan-STARRS A new video shows the evolution of Keplerâ€™s Supernova Remnant using data from NASAâ€™s Chandra X-ray Observatory captured over more than two and a half decades. Keplerâ€™s Supernova Remnant, named after the German astronomer Johannes Kepler, was first spotted in the night sky in 1604. Today, astronomers know that a white dwarf star exploded when it exceeded a critical mass, after pulling material from a companion star, or merging with another white dwarf. This kind of supernova is known as a Type Ia, and scientists use it to measure the expansion of the universe. Supernova remnants, the debris fields left behind after a stellar explosion, ofâ€¦

body: Credit: NASA NASA has selected ARES Technical Services Corporation of McLean, Virginia, to provide launch range operations support at the agencyâ€™s Wallops Flight Facility in Virginia. The Wallops Range Contract has a total potential value of $339.8 million with a one-year base period expected to begin Tuesday, Feb. 10, and four one-year option periods that if exercised would extend it to 2031. The contract includes a cost-plus-fixed-fee core with an indefinite-delivery/indefinite-quantity component and the ability to issue cost-plus-fixed-fee or firm-fixed-price task orders. The scope of the work includes launch range operations support such as radar, telemetry, logistics, tracking, and communications services for flight vehicles including orbital and suborbital rockets, aircraft, satellites, balloons, and unmanned aerial systems. Additional responsibilities include information and computer systems services; testing, modifying, and installing communications and electronic systems at launch facilities, launch control centers, and test facilities; and range technology sustainment engineering services. Work will primarily occur at NASA Wallops with additional support at sites such asâ€¦

title: Breaking: Google will now only release Android source code twice a year
summary: Google has announced that it will publish Android source code to AOSP in Q2 and Q4 of each year.
body: The operating system that powers every Android phone and tablet on the market is based on AOSP , short for the Android Open Source Project. Google develops and releases AOSP under the permissive Apache 2.0 License, which allows any developer to use, modify, and distribute their own operating systems based on the project without paying fees or releasing their own modified source code. Since beginning the project, Google released the source code for nearly every new version of Android for mobile devices, typically doing so within days of rolling out the corresponding update to its own Pixel mobile devices. Starting this year, however, Google is making a major change to its release schedule for Android source code drops: AOSP sources will only be released twice a year. Google told Android Authority that, effective 2026, Google will publish new source code to AOSP in Q2 and Q4. The reason is to ensure platform stability for the Android ecosystem and better align with Androidâ€™s trunk-stable development model . Developers navigating to source.android.com today will see a banner confirming the change that reads as follows:

body: 6 Min Read NASA Marshall Prepares for Demolition of Historic Test, Simulation Facilities Engineers and technicians hoist the first flight version of the Saturn IB rocket's first stage into the T-tower for static testing at NASAâ€™s Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama, on March 15, 1965. Credits: NASA NASA is preparing for the demolition of three iconic structures at the agencyâ€™s Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama. Crews began demolition in mid-December at the Neutral Buoyancy Simulator, a facility built in the late 1960s that once enabled NASA astronauts and researchers to experience near-weightlessness. The facility was also used to conduct underwater testing of space hardware and practice runs for servicing the Hubble Space Telescope. The simulator was closed in 1997. Two test stands â€“ the Propulsion and Structural Test Facility and Dynamic Test Facility â€“ are also slated for demolition, one after the other, by carefully coordinated implosion no earlier than sunrise on Jan. 10, 2026. summary: Great smart lighting and AI combined to produce a light spectacle!
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority As revolutionary as it is, current smart lighting isnâ€™t as intelligent as we think. Sure, you can turn lights on and off, automate them, manage them using voice commands, and even change their colors. That canâ€™t be the limit, right? Learn more about Govee at CES 2026 I had no idea of how the future of smart lighting could look until I stepped into Goveeâ€™s booth at CES 2026 . It was a light show unlike anything I have ever seen before, shedding light into what seemed like a total mystery.

title: Razerâ€™s new concept headphones have built-in cameras and all the AI you need
summary: Razer's new concept headphones are about a lot more than audio it seems.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR At CES 2026, Razer revealed Project Motoko, an AI-powered headphone concept with built-in cameras that can answer questions and understand its surroundings via voice commands. Razer is pitching headphones as a new way to control AI, offering environmental awareness and support for major AI platforms, though it remains a concept with no product plans confirmed. Razer also showcased new AI-focused accessories at the event, including the Wolverine V3 BT controller designed for ultra-low-latency gaming on compatible LG TVs. Razer is no stranger to showing off cool concept ideas at trade shows like CES , including stuff like a high-tech facemask and a climate-controlled chair . This year, the company has something equally innovative to share in the form of Project Motoko. At first glance, youâ€™d assume that these were simply a pair of Bluetooth headphones, but underneath youâ€™ll find an incredible amount of AI-powered smarts. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: I saw Razerâ€™s AI headphones, and they could be the perfect alternative to smart glasses
summary: Move over smart glasses, it's time for smart headphones.
body: CES is always home to some of the most experimental tech of the year, and thatâ€™s thanks in part to Razer. Last year, Razer stole the show with its Project Arielle gaming chair with heating and cooling controls. For CES 2026 , Razerâ€™s latest concept device is something even wilder: AI headphones. Every company is indeed cramming AI into as many devices and form factors as possible, so Iâ€™d forgive you if your knee-jerk reaction is to write off Razerâ€™s AI headphones (known as Project Motoko) as just more AI nonsense. But having seen Project Motoko in action, Razerâ€™s actually created something really interesting and worthwhile.

title: Roborock marches into 2026 with a robot vacuum equipped with legs
summary: The self-balancing "wheel leg" system can scale stairs as easily as it can climb over obstacles.
body: TL;DR Roborockâ€™s CES lineup introduces the Saros Rover, a robot vacuum with legs it can balance on. The Saros lineup is also adding two new 20-series high-end models, including one with a sonic mop. Roborock rounds things out with the affordable new Qrevo Curv 2 Flow and F25 ACE Pro we/dry vac. We knew it was going to be something big, something fantastical â€” last year at CES, Roborock gave a vacuum a robot arm , and lately itâ€™s been teasing what sure looked like another major mobility breakthrough . Sure enough, today in Las Vegas, Roborock has unveiled its latest smart home cleaning solutions, including the Saros Rover, a â€œwheel-legâ€ robotic vacuum that can pass over obstacles, climb stairs â€” and even jump . Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Samsungâ€™s Galaxy S26 faces a value problem it canâ€™t ignore
summary: Regional price increases could make the S26 the most divisive Galaxy ever.
body: Affiliate Disclosure: This post may contain affiliate links, when you buy through links in the description we may earn an affiliate commission. See our affiliate link policy for more details: https:\/\/www.androidauthority.com\/external-links\/ Follow the Team: Paul Jones: https:\/\/x.com\/1paulj_ C.Scott Brown: https:\/\/www.threads.com\/@c.scottbrown Lanh Nguyen: https:\/\/www.instagram.com\/lanhnguyenfilms\/ Harley Maranan: https:\/\/x.com\/harleymaranan Edgar Cervantes: https:\/\/x.com\/5Reflections Mishaal Rahmann: https:\/\/x.com\/MishaalRahmanâ€ json_ld_thumbnail=â€https://i.ytimg.com/vi/8Nx5OLMak2s/maxresdefault.jpgâ€ json_ld_upload_date=â€2025-12-13T08:00:25-05:00â€³]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8Nx5OLMak2s Weâ€™re barely a week into 2026 and the year isnâ€™t shaping up to be a particularly great one for our bank balances. The global RAM squeeze is expected to drive up the cost of countless gadgets in the coming months. According to the latest reports, the Galaxy S26 series is set for a price hike when it launches in just a few weeksâ€™ time. The news comes shortly after Samsung Electronics failed to reach a longer-term agreement to buy memory chips from its sister division, Samsuâ€¦

title: Garmin finally adds native food tracking, but youâ€™ll have to pay for it
summary: Garmin puts food tracking behind its Connect+ subscription.
body: Credit: Garmin TL;DR Garmin finally integrates full nutrition tracking directly into the Garmin Connect app, announced at CES 2026. You can see calories burned and consumed together, log macros, and connect meals directly to training, recovery, and sleep inside Garmin Connect. Garminâ€™s Active Intelligence ties what you eat to how you recover and sleep, surfacing insights like how late meals may impact rest. If you use your Garmin watch to track runs, sleep, and stress but log your food in a different app, Garmin is making things easier. At CES 2026 , the company announced a big update to Garmin Connect that now includes full nutrition tracking. According to Garminâ€™s press release , you can now view both burned and consumed calories in one place, get AI insights on how your diet impacts recovery, and see how your meals relate to your performance.

title: OnePlus 16 leak hints at a new â€˜Proâ€™ or â€˜Ultraâ€™ model to rival the best of Android
summary: The company is reportedly shifting strategy to release a high-end "all-rounder" in late 2026.
body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR OnePlus is reportedly considering a â€œProâ€ or â€œUltraâ€ model for the first time since 2022. Leaks suggest that the 2026 flagship will be an â€œall-rounderâ€ that has evolved based on current customer feedback. The rumored device is expected to arrive in Q4 2026, in line with the companyâ€™s conventional yearly release cycle. OnePlus had an interesting 2025. The company started strong with the OnePlus 13, 13R, and 13s, but then came along the OnePlus 15 and 15R , which left behind some of the highlights of their predecessors. While the new phones are only a few months old at this point, leaks have already begun to emerge for the successor to the OnePlus 15, and it appears the company could right some wrongs this year.
